definitions: To stimulate or incite (someone) to do or feel something, especially by arousing anger or other strong emotions.
To intentionally make someone angry or annoyed.
To cause a reaction or feeling, especially a strong or unwelcome one, in someone.
To bring about or stimulate a reaction or emotion in someone.
examples: His remarks provoked a storm of protest.
The child was provoking the dog.
Her silence provoked him to speak.
